description: From Middle English perpetrat (“committed, perteptrated”), from Latin perpetrātus, past participle of perpetrare (“to carry through”), from per (“through”) + patrare (“to perform”), akin to potis (“able”), potens (“powerful”); see potent.

verbs.description: perpetrate (third-person singular simple present perpetrates, present participle perpetrating, simple past and past participle perpetrated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To be guilty of, or responsible for a crime etc; to commit.
